injuries: Feb 3: Lindholm (lower body) is not expected back prior to the 4 Nations Face-Off, Fluto Shinzawa of The Athletic reports.
Feb 18: Greenway (undisclosed) is "ready" to suit up versus the Rangers on Saturday, Lance Lysowski of The Buffalo News reports.
Dec 4: Kirkland underwent ACL surgery Wednesday and will miss the rest of the 2024-25 campaign.
Nov 11: Mantha will undergo season-ending ACL surgery on his knee Thursday.
Jan 24: Head coach Rod Brind'Amour said Friday that Carrier (lower body) has undergone surgery and is facing a long-term absence, Chip Alexander of The Raleigh News & Observer reports.
Oct 9: Fast (neck) was shifted to long-term injured reserve Wednesday, per PuckPedia.
Jan 27: General manager Kyle Davidson said Monday that he's hopeful that Brossoit (knee) will be able to return at some point this season, Charlie Roumeliotis of WGN Radio reports.
Feb 21: Nichushkin (lower body) will not travel with the Avalanche during their upcoming two-game road trip that starts Saturday in Nashville, according to Evan Rawal of the Denver Gazette.
Oct 6: Colorado received Poolman (head) and a 2025 fourth-round draft pick from Vancouver on Sunday in exchange for Erik Brannstrom.
Feb 4: Heiskanen underwent successful knee surgery in New York on Tuesday and is being labeled month-to-month, Stars radio analyst Bruce LeVine reports.
Feb 1: The Stars put Seguin (leg/hip) on long-term injured reserve Saturday, according to Stars radio analyst Bruce LeVine.
Feb 1: Lundkvist underwent surgery to repair his shoulder Friday and will miss the remainder of the season.
Feb 2: Kaprizov (lower body) was placed on long-term injured reserve Sunday.
Feb 18: Hischier (upper body) participated in Tuesday's practice and hopes to play versus Dallas on Saturday, Mike Morreale of NHL.com reports.
Feb 18: Markstrom (knee) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday.
Feb 18: Mayfield (lower body) told reporters he is hoping to be available for Sunday's matchup with Dallas, per Andrew Gross of Newsday.
Feb 8: Barzal had a procedure done on his kneecap Thursday and is expected to miss about six weeks, Pierre LeBrun of TSN reports Saturday.
Feb 1: Hogberg (upper body) will have his status assessed after the 4 Nations Face-Off, GM Lou Lamoriello announced Saturday.
Feb 1: Varlamov (lower body) is out indefinitely, GM Lou Lamoriello announced Saturday.
Jan 26: Dobson (lower body) was placed on long-term injured reserve Saturday, per PuckPedia.
Feb 21: Norris (undisclosed) will miss Saturday's clash against Montreal, per Bruce Garrioch of Postmedia on Friday.
Feb 18: Gregor (lower body) practiced Tuesday and could return to the lineup against Montreal on Saturday, according to TSN 1200 Ottawa.
Feb 2: Bernard-Docker (ankle) was transferred to long-term injured reserve Sunday, according to PuckPedia.
Feb 1: Cousins underwent knee surgery and is expected to miss at least a couple of months, Julian McKenzie of The Athletic reports.
Feb 17: Rakell (illness) will not suit up for Team Sweden against Team USA on Monday, Elliotte Friedman of Sportsnet relays.
Feb 18: Rutta (lower body) is healing slower than anticipated and is not expected back soon, Max Miller of NHL.com reports.
Feb 18: Kovalenko (upper body) could return during the middle of the Sharks' seven game road trip, Max Miller of NHL.com reports.
Feb 18: Sturm (lower body) is expected to be back in action Sunday versus the Flames, Max Miller of NHL.com reports.
Nov 2: Couture (groin) has not resumed skating and remains without a timeline to return, Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now reported Friday.
Feb 19: Montour (upper body) is with the Kraken for the start of their three-game road trip, Kate Shefte of The Seattle Times reports.
Feb 17: Eberle (pelvis) was recalled from his conditioning assignment with AHL Coachella Valley on Monday.
Oct 8: Krug (ankle) was moved to long-term injured reserve Tuesday, per PuckPedia.
Feb 1: Hakanpaa (knee) won't participate in the upcoming 4 Nations Face-Off.
Feb 21: Morrissey (illness) will miss Saturday's clash against St. Louis, per Mike McIntyre of the Winnipeg Free Press on Friday.
Jan 30: Barron (undisclosed) is considered week-to-week according to head coach Scott Arniel on Thursday, per Mitchell Clinton of the Jets' official site.
